channel.title: Server 2008 on Sam Martin
channel.description: Recent content in Server 2008 on Sam Martin

item.title: Windows Server 2008 Domain Controllers unable to authenticate login requests.
item.description: Recently I was faced with a problem. My Window Server 2003 DCs could authenticate logins fine, but my Windows Server 2008 DCs didn’t work at all. Naturally, in this situation you run good old DCDIAG against the servers in question. In my case, it came back with: dsbindwithspnex() failed with error 1753 Which, with a brief google, leads you to Troubleshooting RPC Endpoint Mapper errors (KB839880). As two servers worked (2k3) and two didn’t (2k8), it seemed likely to be a simple firewall misconfiguration.
